DataElement.preferredName: Mantle Cell Lymphoma International Prognostic Index Risk Assessment Score
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Prognostic index score predictive of outcome in advanced mantle cell lymphoma based on four factors that have independent prognostic relevance including age, performance status, LDH, and white blood cell count (WBC).

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Mantle Cell Lymphoma International Prognostic Index Risk Assessment
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A prognostic index for mantle cell lymphoma based on: age, performance status, lactate dehydrogenase (LDH), and leukocyte count. It differentiates patients into low-, intermediate-, and high-risk groups._An estimated probability that one or more adverse event(s) will occur as a result of exposure to an actual or potential hazardous situation or chemical.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Mantle Cell Lymphoma International Prognostic Index
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A prognostic index for mantle cell lymphoma based on: age, performance status, lactate dehydrogenase (LDH), and leukocyte count. It differentiates patients into low-, intermediate-, and high-risk groups.

Concepts.longName: Mantle Cell Lymphoma International Prognostic Index
Concepts.definition: A prognostic index for mantle cell lymphoma based on: age, performance status, lactate dehydrogenase (LDH), and leukocyte count. It differentiates patients into low-, intermediate-, and high-risk groups.

Property.preferredDefinition: The qualitative or quantitative estimation of the likelihood of adverse effects that may result from exposure to specified health hazards or from the absence of beneficial influences.

Concepts.definition: An estimated probability that one or more adverse event(s) will occur as a result of exposure to an actual or potential hazardous situation or chemical.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.
